title: Sauron the Necromancer | Tolkien Explained
summary:
For a period of over 1500 years, Sauron is known as the mysterious "Necromancer" of Dol Guldur.  Why does he get this name?  What definition of Necromancer is Tolkien using? And does Sauron have power over the dead?

Hit subscribe and the bell for great Tolkien content every week!

title: Unboxing Éomer's Scabbard | LOTR Collectibles
summary:
Check out Éomer's Scabbard: bit.ly/NOTR-Eomer--Scabbard

Product Description:
This authentically detailed scabbard replica is a reproduction of the actual filming prop used in “The Lord Of The Rings” films presented by New Line Cinema. It is designed to fit the Sword of Eomer (UC3383). It features a solid metal chape, collar, and locket with horse heads, all finished with an antique brass-plating. The wood core is wrapped in durable PVC leather to match the look of the prop. Close attention to detail was a top priority. All officially-licensed replicas feature the film copyright notice clearly marked on the product along with a certificate to verify its authenticity.

#unboxing #lordoftherings #eomer

title: LIVE from Oxonmoot with Brian Sibley, the Tolkien Society, and more!
summary:
We'll be LIVE from the Lamb & Flag pub in Oxford, UK during the Tolkien Society's annual Tolkien conference: Oxonmoot!  Joining me will be Brian Sibley, Dr. Kristine Larsen, and Shaun Gunner (chair, Tolkien Society).

#oxonmoot #tolkien #oxford

title: War of the Rohirrim DELAYED, Return to Moria Gameplay Revealed & More!
summary:
For the first time in a while, we got news from two separate Middle-earth projects.  We'll chat about War of the Rohirrim being delayed until December 2024 and check out some of the gameplay from the new Return to Moria game!

Check out the full IGN 13-minute Return to Moria gameplay: https://youtu.be/270uflOMbMk?si=14gPzxwKbmISzUxi

#waroftherohirrim #returntomoria #lordoftherings

title: Kate Hawley, Costume Designer, The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power
summary:
We talk to Emmy-nominated Costume Designer Kate Hawley at San Diego Comic Con.  Her credits include projects such as Crimson Peak, Edge of Tomorrow, Mortal Engines, and most recently, The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power.  She is also credited as a member of the Costume Department for The Hobbit trilogy.

title: Wētā Workshop Interview with Richard Taylor, Jed Brophy, & Gino Acevedo | SDCC 2023
summary:
Today, I catch up with Wētā Workshop's Sir Richard Taylor & Gino Acevedo as well as fan-favorite Middle-earth actor Jed Brophy to talk about their SDCC panel, their exciting new collectibles, over 20 years of working in Middle-earth, and whether they're ready for another go-round with potential new films!

#sdcc #lordoftherings #wetaworkshop
